resources.string: Please provide your password to login
No data file has been found.\nTo continue, please provide your login password
Read/Write permissions are required for ColoCrypter to work.\nTo enable them go to Settings -> General -> Apps -> ColoCrypter -> Permissions\nThen enable Storage
All Access file permissions required so that writing in the Documents directory is enabled.
This problem should not have happened. Please restart the app . If problem persists contact the application\'s developer and provide the error code.
Minimum size for login password is:
Generated passwords have to have at least 4 characters
There already exists an entry with the name:
The entry input cannot be empty

1) Use your favorite notepad app to generate you password file and save it as data.csv.

2) Each line in the file in an entry in the app, so each line will have the following format Name,Username,Password,Notes. So here is an example: 

		Work mail, john, 1234, My favourite password
		Streaming, johnnyboy, johnis12nofun!. 

Note that the fourth column is optional. If a row contains a field with reserved characters or if the name already exists, the the row will be omitted

3) The data.csv file should be put in your device in the App's Folder.
This is located in 
 Internal Storage/ccrypt (Before Android 11) or 
 Documents/ccrypt (Android 11 and up) for 

4) You are done! Click IMPORT below.
At least one type of character must be used.
Incorrect format for the data.csv file. Please check that it is a proper CSV.
The data.csv file could not be imported. Please check that it is in the ccrypt folder

It is highly recommended that you backup you password file, especially after changing or adding a critical password. Your file is encrypted so it is safe.

Your password file is located on the directory ccrypt of your Internal Storage (or Documents if your have Android Version over 11) and it is named data.aux. 

To backup your passwords simply copy your file to any other location. Cloud services are a very simple and effective option.

The ccrypt folder will be generated by the app. So if your phone is changed, lost, broken or stolen, simply download the app again in your new device, copy your backup of data.aux to the created folder and that is it. 

Also if you uninstall the app the data.aux file will remain.
